projectMrHouston.name: mrHouston Tech Solutions
projectMrHouston.description: I built the company's style architecture from scratch, providing structure, scalability, and maintainability, making it the foundation for more efficient and consistent Front-End development.
projectMrHouston.description2: In addition, I work on Full Stack projects, handling both Front-End and Back-End tasks, including authentication, role management, and resolving production issues.
projectMrHouston.technologies: HTML, CSS, C# Blazor, .NET, Java, MySql, Postgres.

projectAgiliza.name: Agiliza
projectAgiliza.description: A startup dedicated to the centralization and presentation of business data. I led the creation of the app, developing the interface that displays BI charts and managing authentication, user control and permissions.

projectMoorishville.name: Moorishville
projectMoorishville.description: Is a county in the United States for which I have worked as a freelancer. My most notable project for them was the development of a system for searching files in a local database.

projectRentalCar.name: RentalCar
projectRentalCar.description: Full Stack project with a backend in Java Spring Boot and a mobile app in Kotlin. Development of secure REST APIs, microservices, and clean architecture.

projectFunko.name: Funko Shop
projectFunko.description: Full e-commerce built with Node, Express, and MySQL. Layout, routing, database, and business logic following the MVC pattern.

projectAhorcado.name: Hangman Game
projectAhorcado.description: Web game developed with HTML5 canvas, CSS, and JavaScript. Responsive interface and game logic implemented from scratch.

projectJardín.name: Bubble Garden
projectJardín.description: Landing page for an educational center with a working form. HTML, CSS, and JS applied to a clear and accessible interface.

projectOtro.name: Shop
projectOtro.description: Online store connected to a public API. Layout and JavaScript logic to filter products and simulate a shopping flow.

eep.title: Full Stack Developer
eep.experience: During this program, I’ve delved into Backend development with Java and Spring Boot, as well as mobile development with Android. A highlight has been building a complete app from scratch, along with projects in Python, C#, and Java that allowed me to work with graphical interfaces, local file handling, and data structures. This educational journey has been key in shaping my profile as a developer, strengthening both my technical skills and my passion for creating functional, well-structured solutions.

about.title: About me
about.paragraph1: I am a Full Stack Developer specialized in Front-End, with a strong focus on JavaScript and React. I always start by understanding the problem before proposing solutions, which allows me to write cleaner, more predictable, and easier-to-maintain code.
about.paragraph2: I have a strong interest in building well-thought-out interfaces, organizing code effectively, and consciously applying patterns and best practices. I see architecture as a tool to reduce complexity, not as an end in itself.
about.paragraph3: I stand out for my ability to organize and manage tasks, as well as for a practical, value-driven approach to product development. I am looking for a team where I can continue to grow, gradually take on more responsibility, and learn from experienced professionals.
about.button: Get to know my personal side

FAQ1.title: Do you have a work permit in Spain?
FAQ1.question: Yes, I have a work permit and I am fully qualified to work in Spain and in the European Union.

FAQ2.title: What is your specialization?
FAQ2.question: I work as a Full Stack Developer with a specialization in Front-End. My main interest lies in creating clear and functional interfaces, always understanding the problem and the full context of the application.
FAQ2.question2: My Back-End knowledge allows me to make better decisions on the Front-End and build more coherent, maintainable solutions.

FAQ3.title: How long have you been working in web development?
FAQ3.question: I started self-studying in 2021 and joined the ORACLE ONE program in 2022, which gave me a more solid foundation and a clearer planorama and since then I have not stopped learning.

FAQ4.title: Do you have experience in agile methodologies?
FAQ4.question: Yes, I have worked with agile methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban. I also like to implement these methodologies in the collaborative projects I lead.

FAQ5.title: What type of project are you looking for?
FAQ5.question: I am looking for projects that are not only technically challenging, but also have a real impact on society, helping to improve people's lives.

FAQ6.title: Are you open to working remotely or hybrid?
FAQ6.question: Yes, I am totally open to continue working remotely, although I am also willing to work hybrid or face-to-face if the project requires it.

FAQ7.title: What has been your greatest professional achievement?
FAQ7.question: One of my greatest professional achievements was taking part in the complete overhaul of a web application that suffered from performance, usability, and accessibility issues.
FAQ7.question1: I had the opportunity to propose and select the most appropriate technical approach, and by working closely with the Back-End team, we developed a new application that addressed the previous limitations and significantly improved the user experience.

FAQ8.title: Are you willing to learn new technologies if required by the project?
FAQ8.question: Of course! I am always willing to keep learning new technologies and to grow professionally.

memi.name: Magdalena Zucal
memi.description: I took several courses with Jesus and he was a great partner, open to work as a team, organizing the group according to the skills and abilities of each participant. His accompaniment was important to allow me to expand my knowledge in those areas I had not yet mastered. He was also always willing and enthusiastic to learn from his colleagues. Orderly, methodical and responsible!
memi.title: Back-End Developer

freelacer.name: Tywan Grant
freelacer.description: Jesus was really easy to work with, and kept everything clear and professional. He was open to changes on the fly, and left none of his inquiries about my project unanswered, opening options up to me that I wasn't even aware of. Very approachable and honest.
freelacer.title: Moorishville Marketing Department Manager

AboutMe.title: More About Me
AboutMe.subtitle: A more human look into my personal and professional story
AboutMe.paragraph1: I'm Venezuelan, and if life has taught me anything, it's that we’re always beginning again. I lived in Argentina for eight years, and just over a year ago, I arrived in Spain. Each move has been a mix of uncertainty, excitement, and lessons that helped me grow far beyond what I expected.
AboutMe.paragraph2: Since I was a kid, I’ve been drawn to technology. I can’t pinpoint exactly when it started, but anything with a screen fascinated me. Computers, video games, devices… it felt like there was a whole universe inside them, waiting to be explored. Today, years later, I still feel that same wonder—only now, I get to build inside that universe.
AboutMe.paragraph3: I love programming not just because it’s logical or challenging, but because there’s something deeply satisfying about solving things. You start with a blank idea, hit walls, get frustrated, try again, and suddenly... it works. That moment makes it all worth it. No matter how complex the problem, I enjoy the challenge—because in the end, it always teaches me something new.
AboutMe.paragraph4: I also have an adventurous side that needs to step out into the real world. I play airsoft, and in the past, I did rock climbing and long hikes. I’ve spent more than 10 days straight in the mountains—and while it may sound intense, those are some of the most meaningful memories I carry with me. Being out there, away from distractions, teaches you to trust yourself, listen to your surroundings, and appreciate the simple things.
AboutMe.paragraph5: I keep learning every single day. I’m not aiming to be perfect—I aim to be authentic, to move forward step by step, and to enjoy the journey, both in code and in life.
AboutMe.paragraph6: Thanks for reading. If you made it this far, then we already share something: curiosity.
AboutMe.caption1: In the background the second highest peak in Venezuela. Humbolt Peak
AboutMe.caption3: With Zeus at La Bola del Mundo. Spain – Madrid.
